docs.abstract: Higher education officials are calling on Congress to fix a provision in the Trump administration’s tax overhaul that has caused unintended tax increases.
docs.snippet: Higher education officials are calling on Congress to fix a provision in the Trump administration’s tax overhaul that has caused unintended tax increases.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A little-noticed provision in President Trump’s sprawling new tax law is treating middle- and low-income college students as if they are trust-fund babies, taxing sizable financial aid packages at a rate first established 33 years ago to prevent wealthy parents from funneling money to their children to lower their tax burdens.

headline.main: Low-Income College Students Are Being Taxed Like Trust-Fund Babies
headline.print_headline: Low-Income College Students Face Tax Increase

docs.abstract: An official said the order followed “the most comprehensive investigation” the department’s office for civil rights “has ever undertaken of sexual violence in a major urban public school system.”
docs.snippet: An official said the order followed “the most comprehensive investigation” the department’s office for civil rights “has ever undertaken of sexual violence in a major urban public school system.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Education Department on Thursday publicly ordered the Chicago public school system to thoroughly overhaul the way it deals with sexual harassment and violence, after the department said it found “widespread” failures to respond to complaints of sexual misconduct by students and staff.

headline.main: Chicago Public Schools Ordered to Toughen Sexual Misconduct Policies
headline.print_headline: Chicago Public Schools Ordered to Toughen Sexual Misconduct Policies

docs.abstract: The results of the test, which assesses a sample of fourth- and eighth-grade students, will inevitably prompt demands for policy change.
docs.snippet: The results of the test, which assesses a sample of fourth- and eighth-grade students, will inevitably prompt demands for policy change.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON —  America’s fourth and eighth graders are losing ground in their ability to read literature and academic texts, according to a rigorous national assessment released Wednesday that is likely to fuel concerns over student achievement after decades of tumult on the educational landscape.

headline.main: Reading Scores on National Exam Decline in Half the States
headline.print_headline: DeVos Calls Slump in Reading Scores a ‘Student Achievement Crisis’

byline.original: By Erica L. Green and Dana Goldstein

docs.abstract: While college campuses have become the battleground for Title IX debates, the mishandling of sexual assault cases in primary and secondary schools receives less attention.
docs.snippet: While college campuses have become the battleground for Title IX debates, the mishandling of sexual assault cases in primary and secondary schools receives less attention.
docs.lead_paragraph: WINCHESTER, Va. — Nausea had consumed her as her attacker pinned her arms down at a park, forced her first kiss upon her, and tried to take off her pants at the tender age of 14, and nausea resurfaced every time she saw him in the hallways of her high school.

headline.main: ‘It’s Like the Wild West’: Sexual Assault Victims Struggle in K-12 Schools
headline.print_headline: A Struggle To Punish Sex Assault In Schools

docs.abstract: The private school in Louisiana, once celebrated for helping underprivileged and minority students attend elite colleges, is now under federal investigation over its college applications.
docs.snippet: The private school in Louisiana, once celebrated for helping underprivileged and minority students attend elite colleges, is now under federal investigation over its college applications.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAFAYETTE, La. — T.M. Landry College Preparatory School, a private school in Louisiana that garnered national attention for helping underprivileged and minority students attend elite colleges, is under federal investigation over its college admissions practices after disclosures that it cut corners and doctored applications, according to multiple people contacted by the F.B.I.

headline.main: F.B.I. Is Said to Be Investigating College Admissions Practices at T.M. Landry
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Is Said to Be Investigating College Admissions Practices at T.M. Landry

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: TM Landry College Preparatory (Breaux Bridge, La)

byline.original: By Katie Benner and Erica L. Green

docs.abstract: An analysis by the Center for American Progress found that the Trump administration was less likely to investigate claims of discrimination against L.G.B.T.Q. students.
docs.snippet: An analysis by the Center for American Progress found that the Trump administration was less likely to investigate claims of discrimination against L.G.B.T.Q. students.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Students who said they were discriminated against because of their sexual orientation or gender identity were significantly less likely to get any relief from the Education Department’s Office for Civil Rights under the Trump administration than they were under the Obama administration, according to a report released Monday.

headline.main: L.G.B.T.Q. Rights Cases Stall Under DeVos, Report Finds
headline.print_headline: L.G.B.T.Q. Students’ Rights Cases Stall Under DeVos, Report Finds

docs.abstract: The Education Department is investigating a Middle East studies program run by Duke and the University of North Carolina, citing, among other issues, how Judaism is discussed.
docs.snippet: The Education Department is investigating a Middle East studies program run by Duke and the University of North Carolina, citing, among other issues, how Judaism is discussed.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Education Department has ordered Duke University and the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill to remake the Middle East studies program run jointly by the two schools after concluding that it was offering students a biased curriculum that, among other complaints, did not present enough “positive” imagery of Judaism and Christianity in the region.

headline.main: U.S. Orders Duke and U.N.C. to Recast Tone in Mideast Studies
headline.print_headline: U.S. Demands Colleges Recast Mideast Focus

docs.abstract: House Democrats announced an ambitious overhaul of the Higher Education Act that would devote hundreds of billions of dollars to college access.
docs.snippet: House Democrats announced an ambitious overhaul of the Higher Education Act that would devote hundreds of billions of dollars to college access.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Democrats on Tuesday unveiled a sweeping overhaul of the federal higher education law, aiming to increase access to college for low-income and minority students with huge infusions of financial aid and the creation of a $94 billion program that allows states to offer tuition-free community college.

headline.main: House Democrats Unveil Plan to Make College More Affordable
headline.print_headline: House Democrats Unveil $400 Billion Plan to Increase Access to College

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: HOUSE COMMITTEE ON EDUCATION AND LABOR

docs.abstract: Months after a major bipartisan bill passed, President Trump is promoting the criminal justice law known as the First Step Act.
docs.snippet: Months after a major bipartisan bill passed, President Trump is promoting the criminal justice law known as the First Step Act.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Monday hosted about 300 guests, including convicted felons, at the White House for the “First Step Act Celebration,” a party intended to bring attention to a rare piece of bipartisan legislation he passed last year, and which he plans to highlight on the campaign trail.

headline.main: Trump Celebrates Criminal Justice Overhaul Amid Doubts It Will Be Fully Funded
headline.print_headline: White House Celebrates Criminal Justice Overhaul

byline.original: By Maggie Haberman and Annie Karni

docs.abstract: Millions of former officials must submit their writings to a prepublication review system, which they argue is unconstitutional.
docs.snippet: Millions of former officials must submit their writings to a prepublication review system, which they argue is unconstitutional.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A newly filed lawsuit is challenging a censorship system the government uses to ensure that millions of former military and intelligence officials spill no secrets if they decide to write articles and books after they move on from public service.

headline.main: Ex-National Security Officials Sue to Limit Censorship of Their Books
headline.print_headline: Former Officials File Suit  Over the Lifelong Limits  On the Words They Write

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the Director of National Intelligence
